isis.stitle: TSI 05-08-07R - 7600, 7700, 8600, 5000i, and 9000i Models, Built Before April 5, 2005, with Cummins ISM and ISX Engines and Extended Life Coolant, may get a False Low Coolant Level Warning which will De-Rate the Engine

subjectgroup.subject: 7600, 7700, 8600, 5000i, and 9000i Models, Built Before April 5, 2005, with Cummins ISM and ISX Engines and Extended Life Coolant, may get a False Low Coolant Level Warning which will De-Rate the Engine

geninfo.title: Revision Description

para.emph: Subject revised to include Extended Life Coolant and model end dates added.

geninfo.para: To eliminate the false low coolant level warning, a kit containing a new coolant level probe and overlay harness will be required. Choose the Service Procedure, that follows, for the model being serviced.

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. Coolant Sensor Probe for 7600, 7700, 8600 and 5000i, 9000i Models

note.para: Before performing the following SERVICE PROCEDURE, determine if the harness module has already been added (see Figure 7 or Figure 14). If the module is present, this SERVICE PROCEDURE is not needed.

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or death, park the vehicle on a flat level surface, set the parking brake, turn the engine off, and chock the wheels.

To avoid personal injury or death from hot coolant or steam, allow the vehicle to cool. Wrap a thick heavy cloth around the radiator cap, push down and loosen the cap to the first notch and allow pressure to release through the overflow tube.

note.para: Refer to Figure 1 to identify harness ends A and B and adaptors C, D, and E in the following Steps.

step1.para: Make sure that the ignition switch is OFF and the ignition key is removed.
Drain radiator coolant until the coolant level in the surge tank is below the coolant sensor probe level (Figure 2).

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. Drain Coolant Level Below Coolant Sensor Probe

step1.para: Unplug existing harness from coolant probe and remove coolant sensor probe.
Install new sensor probe from kit. Do not over tighten, hand tighten only.

Route overlay harness starting with end "A" at the coolant sensor probe, across front of engine, under air cleaner, and finish with end "B" near connector 4004 on the driver side of the engine bulkhead (Figure 3 and Figure 7).
Remove nut from cab ground stud shown in Figure 3.

figure.caption: Figure 3. Ground Stud and Connector 4004 Locations

step1.para: Install eyelet terminal at the B end of the overlay harness onto ground stud and re-install nut.
Apply Grafo grease over ground stud and eyelet terminal.
Remove red lock tab from connector 4004 (Figure 3) and pull connector away from bulkhead connector.
Open the shell of connector 4004 and remove the plug from cavity 28 (Figure 4).
Remove terminal lock from pin side of connector shown in Figure 5.
Insert harness adapter "E" with terminal end into cavity 28.

figure.caption: Figure 5. Install Adaptor "E" Lead Into Cavity 28

step1.para: Re-install terminal lock, close shell, and tie strap harness to connector body
Re-install connector 4004 into bulkhead connector.
Connect overlay harness "B" end connector to the harness adapter "E" installed into connector 4004 as shown in Figure 5.
Connect original coolant probe harness to mating plug on overlay harness at the coolant expansion tank.
Connect new overlay harness connector to the new coolant sensor probe.
Connect the four-way connector on the new overlay harness to the new coolant control module.
Route the new overlay harness to allow the new control module to be tie strapped to the alternator harness as shown in Figure 6. Mount the module so the connector is facing down.

figure.caption: Figure 6. Tie Strap Module to Alternator Harness

step1.para: Clip the remainder of the harness to prevent wearing and chafing of the wires. Follow the main harness over the top of the engine and under the air cleaner. Make certain the overlay harness does not interfere with the inside edge of the hood on the drivers side. Final routing should follow Figure 7.

figure.caption: Figure 7. Overlay Harness Routing for 7600, 7700, 8600 Models

step1.para: Refill with the appropriate coolant to the correct level.
Check for leaks.

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or death, park the vehicle on a flat level surface, set the parking brake, turn the engine off, and chock the wheels.

To avoid personal injury or death from hot coolant or steam, allow the vehicle to cool. Wrap a thick heavy cloth around the radiator cap, push down and loosen the cap to the first notch and allow pressure to release through the overflow tube.

note.para: Refer to Figure 1 to identify harness ends A and B and adaptors C, D, and E in the following Steps.

step1.para: Make sure that the ignition switch is OFF and the ignition key is removed.
Drain radiator coolant until the coolant level is below the coolant sensor level in the overflow tank as shown in Figure 2.
Unplug existing harness from coolant sensor probe and remove coolant sensor probe.
Install new coolant sensor probe from kit. Do not over tighten, hand tighten only.

Route the "B" end of the new harness overlay from the coolant sensor up the front of the engine, rearward along the right side of the rocker box and then outward under the air cleaner to the area of the three bulkhead connections on the right side of the engine compartment. See Figure 13.
Remove the nut from the ground stud beside the three bulkhead connectors shown in Figure 8.
Install eyelet terminal on ground stud and re-install nut.

figure.caption: Figure 8. Connector 2 and Ground Stud Locations

step1.para: Remove lock bolt from Connector 2 with a ¼" nut driver. Lock bolt is located in the center of the connector.
Locate cavity "G" in connector 2 (Figure 9). Cavity "G" is directly above the connector keyway.

figure.caption: Figure 9. Location of Cavity "G" (Screwdriver Used as Pointer)

step1.para: Remove the terminal lock from behind cavity "G"
Remove the wire and terminal from cavity "G". This is Circuit 71, 16 gauge orange wire. Use proper tool to release terminal from connector body.
Insert terminal end of adapter "D" shown in Figure 1 into cavity "G" of Connector 2.
Install connector body "C" adapter onto wire (Circuit 71) and terminal removed from Connector 2 in step 11 above.
Connect body adapter with terminal installed in Step 12 above to single male connector on end of "Y" harness adapter "D" (Figure 10).

figure.caption: Figure 10. Connect Adaptors C and D

step1.para: Install the other leg of the "Y" adapter to the male connector on end "B" of the overlay harness. Final connections should look like Figure 10. above.
Re-install terminal lock onto the back of Connector 2.
Re-install Connector 2 into bulkhead connector. Tighten connector lock bolt.
Tie strap the connectors and excess wire to harness feeding bulkhead connectors as shown in Figure 11.

figure.caption: Figure 11. Tie Strap Connectors and Excess Wire to Harness

step1.para: Tie strap the remainder of the overlay harness back to the coolant level sensor. Be sure to keep the overlay harness away from the exhaust system on the right side of the engine.
Tie strap the module to the alternator harness as shown in Figure 12. Final routing should follow Figure 13.

figure.caption: Figure 12. Module and Coolant Sensor Overlay Harness Routing
Figure 13. Overlay Harness Routing for 5000i, 9000i Models

step1.para: Refill with the appropriate coolant to the correct level.
Check for leaks.
